results.title: Wagner. - Volume 2.
results.brief_description: Part two of this major drama production which coincided with the centenary of Richard Wagner’s death. Wagner remains an enigma with his rags-to-riches saga with a fairytale end. He was loved yet hated, admired yet despised, a villain yet a hero. Wagner was worshipped and a man whose fame and exploits were the gossip of Europe. Above all, he was an incurable romantic, whose love affair with Liszt’s illegitimate daughter rivals that of Romeo and Juliet in excitement and drama. This is Wagner’s story - the story of one of the greatest composers who ever lived.

results.title: Wagner. - Volume 1.
results.brief_description: Wagner - the film is one of the most important independent productions ever attempted, bringing together the talents of some of Britain’s most prominent musical and theatrical names. Music is conducted by Sir Georg Solti and the production stars Richard Burton as Wagner with Vanessa Redgrave, Sir John Gielgud, Sir Ralph Richardson and Sir Laurence Olivier. This is the first in a two part series which chronicles the rags-to-riches saga of Richard Wagner - one of the greatest composers that ever lived.

results.title: Wages and production
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Terry Kahn Organization, Arla Sorkin and Ilene Kahn
results.brief_description:
Applies demand and supply principles to labour. Shows how wage rates affect the kinds and amounts of labour services offered and the amount demanded. Presents some factors affecting wage rates.
Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Wagerup weekend
results.brief_description: Examines the campaign by environmentalists to stop the construction of an Alcoa aluminium smelter at Wagerup (near Perth, WA). Looks at the reasons behind the conservation movement and shows the nature of non-violent civil disobedience and its consequences. Highlights the difficulties facing protest groups in Western Australia and the importance of the Courts in their struggle. Suitable for secondary level.

results.brief_description: Three classic rare shorts from the great misanthrope child and dog hater and alcohol lover. The Dentist, 1932. The Fatal Glass of Beer, 1933. The Golf Specialist, 1930.

results.title: W.B Yeats: a tribute
results.creator_credit: National Film Institute of Ireland, George Fleischmann and John Desmond Sheridan
results.brief_description: The life story of the Irish poet, William Butler Yeats, is told against scenes of places which influenced his life and work, including his home county of Sligo and the Abbey Theatre in Dublin. Relevant quotations from his poems are read to create an impression of the man and his work.

results.title: W. Somerset Maugham's Trio
results.creator_credit: Two Cities Films, Antony Darnborough, Ken Annakin and Harold French
results.brief_description: ‘Trio’ forms the second of three movie anthologies based on the short stories of British author W. Somerset Maugham. Other titles in the anthology include ‘Quartet’ (303249), and ‘Encore’ (309327). Stories include: ‘The Verger’; a verger’s fortunes change when he is dismissed by the Bishop: ‘Mr Knowall’ (Nigel Patrick), is an excruciating and over enthusiastic individual who bores his fellow passengers during a voyage, and: ‘Sanitorium’; Jean Simmons, Michael Rennie and Roland Culver star as tuberculosis patients who find some happiness despite their condition. Cast includes James Hayter, Kathleen Harrison and Felix Alymer. Introduced by Somerset Maugham.

results.title: W. Somerset Maugham's Encore
results.creator_credit: Two Cities Films, Antony Darnborough, Harold French, Pat Jackson and Anthony Pelissier
results.brief_description: ‘Encore’ forms the final instalment of three movie anthologies based on the short stories of British author W. Somerset Maugham. Other titles in the anthology include ‘Quartet’ (303249), and ‘Trio’ (309324). Stories include: ‘The Ant and the grasshopper’; brothers Tom and George Ramsay (Nigel Patrick and Roland Culver), attempt to outdo each other over money; ‘Winter cruise’; grouchy matron Miss Read is in danger of ruining a cruise, and; ‘Gigolo and Gogolette’; poised to perform her most death defying act, trapeze artist Glynis Johns suffers a panic attack when she suspects her husband and manager are conspiring to abuse her. Cast includes Nigel Patrick, Roland Culver, Kay Walsh and Noel Purcell. Introduced by Somerset Maugham.

results.title: VUWAE 15, Darwin Mountains, Antarctica
results.creator_credit: Victoria University of Wellington Antarctic Expedition, Peter Barrett and John Pettigrew
results.brief_description: Shows the geological research carried out by members of the fifteenth Victoria University of Wellington Antarctic Expedition (VUWAE 15). A party of four measure and describe the exposed outcrops of the Darwin Mountains, part of the Transantarctic Mountains. Presents a detailed description of the geology of the area.

results.title: Vukani awake
results.creator_credit: Concord Films Council for the African National Congress and Lionel Ngakane
results.brief_description: Shows the plight of black Africans in South Africa. The first film of protest against the South African situation made by a South African, Lionel Ngakane. Some of the original footage was smuggled out of South Africa, while the compilation material was assembled from a wide variety of African and British sources.
